# Prerequisites

## Import libraries

```{r Import R Libraries, message=FALSE, results='hide', echo=TRUE}
# General purpose R libraries
library(readr)
library(dplyr)
library(forcats)
library(kableExtra)
library(gridExtra)

# Graphs
library(ggplot2)
library(ggtext) # Add support for HTML/CSS on ggplot

# Other R packages
library(fontawesome)

# Other settings
options(digits=4) # print only 4 decimals
options(warn = -1)
```

```{r, include=FALSE}
# Add loaded libraries to bibliography section

knitr::write_bib(.packages(), file = 'packages.bib')
```


## Import data

```{r}
kaggle_2021 = read_csv("data/kaggle_survey_2021.csv")

# Delete second line
kaggle_2021 = kaggle_2021[-c(1),]
```

## Prepare Data

Since my analysis is based on Greek users, I split the dataset into two parts. One part includes exclusively Greek users and all the rest another. Thus, we can observe any peculiarities or similarities with broader Kaggle's userbase.

```{r}
kaggle_2021$Q3[kaggle_2021$Q3 != "Greece"] <- "Other" 
```


# Prevalent DS Language

```{r}
kaggle_2021 %>%
  group_by(Q2, Q3) %>%
  summarise(n = n()) %>%
  filter(Q2 %in% c("Man","Woman"))
```
